Package org.dei.whynot

org.dei.whynot implements a Why Not explanation module The classes implementing the module reside in package org.dei.whynot, which include five classes: CheckWorkingMemory DroolsInit KnowledgeBase RuleWM WhyNot

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CheckWorkingMemory
    Class CheckWorkingMemory is used to verify why a conclusion is false, searching for the causes that that prevented a conclusion to be obtained
    DroolsInit
    DroolsInit class is used to create a Drools KieSession and all the required assets needed to generate whynot explanations
    KnowledgeBase
    KnowledgeBase class is used to represent in memory the contents of the DRL files included in the project, plus a set of dynamically generated queries to evaluate rule conditions.
    RuleWM
    RuleWM class is used to describe a rule using the rule description gathered from DRL file parsing
    WhyNot
    WhyNot class implements the singleton pattern to ensure the creation of an unique instance.

Package org.dei.whynot Description

org.dei.whynot implements a Why Not explanation module The classes implementing the module reside in package org.dei.whynot, which include five classes:
  • CheckWorkingMemory
  • DroolsInit
  • KnowledgeBase
  • RuleWM
  • WhyNot

Requirements:

  • DRL files must be placed in a subfolder of ProjectBaseDir/src/main/resources, complying with a Drools Maven project structure
  • Classes used to define Working Memory facts must all be placed in the same package;
  • this package is be passed to the constructor of DroolsInit class

Usage:

  • Call static method DroolsInit.initiateDrools(java.lang.String factsPackage): this method builds the knowledge base with rules from drl files and queries dynamically generated, and creates a KieSession
  • Instantiate WhyNot class using the static method init(org.dei.whynot.DroolsWithWhyNot drools)
    • Where drools is an object returned by DroolsInit.initiateDrools(java.lang.String factsPackage)
  • After obtaining a conclusion, an explanation WhyNot can be asked calling the static method:
    • getWhyNotExplanation(java.lang.String expectedConclusion)
      • Where expectedConclusion is a String containing the expected conclusion ("why not expected conclusion is true?") following the format Functor(functor parameters ...), such as "Fruit(Values.WATERMELON)"
Author:
Luiz Faria
